Class DlbNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • DlbNode

  • public class DlbNode
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a node of a DLB trie contains an array of the entire child level rather than have multiple nodes for each level

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int count 
      java.lang.String data 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DlbNode(java.io.PrintWriter my_dictionary, boolean subFlag)
      Root level constructor, contains output writer and boolean flag saying whether or not to substitute data
      DlbNode(java.lang.String word, DlbNode parent, boolean subFlag)
      Non-root node constructor containing data to be stored and a parent reference Contains entire level of the trie in one node rather than as a peer linked list

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.String word)
      Adds data to the trie, and pushes additional data further down the trie into new child nodes Additionally, calls the function that replaces eligible characters with symbols if necessary
      int findPrefix(java.lang.String password, int originalLength)
      Returns the longest prefix of data possible
      int findSimilar(java.lang.String password, java.lang.StringBuilder toWrite, int prefixLength, int similarCount)
      Finds passwords with longest possible prefix in common with an invalid user password attempt
      char getNextChar(int i)
      Uses ASCII character numbering to shortcut getting a new character

      Generates valid passwords one character at a time, pruning as it goes
      void setData(java.lang.String data)
      Testing method for manual data setting, not used in final version
      void startGeneration(java.lang.StringBuilder pass, int numChars, int numNums, int numSymbols, java.io.PrintWriter goodPass)
      Generates the first character in what will become a five character password Additionally, manages file i/o for each smaller sub file
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the data contained in a node of the dlb trie in String form Used for testing but not intrinsic to program functionality

      Prints the trie data to a file

    • Constructor Detail

      • DlbNode

        public DlbNode(java.io.PrintWriter my_dictionary,
               boolean subFlag)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Root level constructor, contains output writer and boolean flag saying whether or not to substitute data
        Parameters:
        my_dictionary - the output file writer for printing the trie
        subFlag - boolean argument that determines whether or not to substitue symbols for letters
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the printwriter passed as a parameter fails

      • DlbNode

        public DlbNode(java.lang.String word,
               DlbNode parent,
               boolean subFlag)
        Non-root node constructor containing data to be stored and a parent reference Contains entire level of the trie in one node rather than as a peer linked list
        Parameters:
        word - the data to be stored or passed down the trie
        parent - reference to parent node in the linked list
        subFlag - boolean argument that determines whether or not to substitue symbols for letters

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.String data)
        Testing method for manual data setting, not used in final version
        Parameters:
        data - the data to set the current node as containing

      • writeTrie

        public void writeTrie(java.lang.StringBuilder currentWord)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Prints the trie data to a file
        Parameters:
        currentWord - the current word that is being built and will be written if eligible
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the my_dictionary file cannot be written to

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String word)
        Adds data to the trie, and pushes additional data further down the trie into new child nodes Additionally, calls the function that replaces eligible characters with symbols if necessary
        Parameters:
        word - the word whose data will be added to the tree recursively

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the data contained in a node of the dlb trie in String form Used for testing but not intrinsic to program functionality
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • startGeneration

        public void startGeneration(java.lang.StringBuilder pass,
                            int numChars,
                            int numNums,
                            int numSymbols,
                            java.io.PrintWriter goodPass)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Generates the first character in what will become a five character password Additionally, manages file i/o for each smaller sub file
        Parameters:
        pass - password or papssword prefix being currently validated
        numChars - number of alphabetic /characters in current password
        numNums - number of arabic numerals in current password
        numSymbols - number of symbols in current password
        goodPass - print writer used to print validated passwords to file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any of the subfiles are unable to be written to

      • recursiveGenerate

        public void recursiveGenerate(java.lang.StringBuilder pass,
                              int numChars,
                              int numNums,
                              int numSymbols,
                              java.io.PrintWriter goodPass,
                              java.io.PrintWriter charWords)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Generates valid passwords one character at a time, pruning as it goes
        Parameters:
        pass - password or papssword prefix being currently validated
        numChars - number of alphabetic /characters in current password
        numNums - number of arabic numerals in current password
        numSymbols - number of symbols in current password
        goodPass - print writer used to print validated passwords to file
        charWords - print writer used to print all passwords starting with same character to a single file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file to write good passwords to cannot be written to

      • getNextChar

        public char getNextChar(int i)
        Uses ASCII character numbering to shortcut getting a new character
        Parameters:
        i - integer generated by recursive generate matching the next character to return
        Returns:
        the ASCII representation of the parameter integer

      • findPrefix

        public int findPrefix(java.lang.String password,
                      int originalLength)
        Returns the longest prefix of data possible
        Parameters:
        password - the password attempt a prefix is being found for
        originalLength - the original length of the attempted password
        Returns:
        the length of the longest prefix

      • findSimilar

        public int findSimilar(java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.StringBuilder toWrite,
                       int prefixLength,
                       int similarCount)
        Finds passwords with longest possible prefix in common with an invalid user password attempt
        Parameters:
        password - all or a portion of the users password attempt
        toWrite - the similar password to be written to screen if qualification checks are passed
        prefixLength - the length of the longest possible prefix of the user password attempt
        similarCount - the number of similar passwords already written to stdout
        Returns:
        the number of similar passwords written to the console
